com.gdb

Class TennisGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gdb.TennisGame

  • public class TennisGame
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to model the scoring of a game of tennis between two players.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TennisGame()
      Default constructor - passes in two names to main constructor.
      TennisGame(java.lang.String playerOne, java.lang.String playerTwo)
      Constructor - initialises scores to zero and initialises names with the given String values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void incrementScore(java.lang.String name)
      Increments the score of the given player.
      java.lang.String reportScore()
      Uses the rules of tennis to determine the correct score to report.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TennisGame

        public TennisGame()
        Default constructor - passes in two names to main constructor.

      • TennisGame

        public TennisGame(java.lang.String playerOne,
                  java.lang.String playerTwo)
        Constructor - initialises scores to zero and initialises names with the given String values.
        Parameters:
        playerOne - Name of player one.
        playerTwo - Name of player two.

    • Method Detail

      • reportScore

        public java.lang.String reportScore()
        Uses the rules of tennis to determine the correct score to report. Initially checks for win, then checks for deuce followed by checking for advantage. If none of these cases are matched then the game is still in progress. Score is reported as [Player One Score] - [Player Two Score].
        Returns:
        A String describing the current score of the game.

      • incrementScore

        public void incrementScore(java.lang.String name)
        Increments the score of the given player.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the player whose score will be implemented.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given name does not match that of playerOne or playerTwo.
